metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: The multi-scale observation experiment on evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces (MUSOEXE-12)-dataset of flux observation matrix (eddy covariance system of Daman superstation lower)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：非均匀下垫面地表蒸散发的多尺度观测试验-通量观测矩阵数据集（大满超级站下层涡动相关仪）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Daman superstation eddy covariance system (EC) at the lowest layer in the flux observation matrix from 25 May to 15 September, 2012. The site (100.37223° E, 38.85551° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in the Daman irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556.06 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.5 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.17 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年5月25日至9月15日的通量观测矩阵中大满超级站下层的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.37223E, 38.85551N，海拔1556.06m。涡动相关仪架高4.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测，这些参数和观测无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更加复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在4.5米高处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，在给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度的情况下，可以使用TSEB模型准确地将E和T从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。针对绿洲-沙漠系统，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可以在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced when collecting multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research is the poor availability of multiscale observation data, which hinders the upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface. This was addressed by the HiWATER experiment, which aimed to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes through instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales.
Example.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测数据时面临的一个挑战是多尺度观测数据的可用性较差，这阻碍了在异质表面上对生态水文过程的上尺度化。HiWATER实验旨在通过以层次嵌套的尺度布置仪器，捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset used to analyze evapotranspiration over an oasis-desert area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于分析绿洲-沙漠地区蒸散发的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset used to analyze evapotranspiration over an oasis-desert area is the multiscale dataset from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) conducted in 2012. It includes data from a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing missions, which were used to study eco-hydrological processes in the oasis-desert interaction.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个用于分析绿洲-沙漠地区蒸散发的示例数据集是2012年进行的“黑河流域联合遥测实验研究”（HiWATER）的多尺度数据集。该数据集包括来自通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感任务的数据，这些数据用于研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的生态水文过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for evapotranspiration estimation using eddy covariance systems compare to those using thermal infrared cameras in terms of accuracy and application in heterogeneous landscapes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 蒸散发估算的涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法与热红外相机的数据收集方法在准确性和在异质景观中的应用方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system provides direct measurements of evapotranspiration but may face challenges in achieving energy balance closure in heterogeneous landscapes. In contrast, using thermal infrared cameras allows for the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which can improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates by addressing the advective conditions present in these landscapes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统提供了蒸散发的直接测量，但在异质景观中可能面临能量平衡闭合的挑战。相比之下，使用热红外相机可以估算土壤和树冠组件的温度，这可以通过解决这些景观中存在的对流条件来提高蒸散发估算的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data quality control measures between datasets obtained from ground-based eddy covariance systems and those from airborne remote sensing platforms in eco-hydrological studies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，基于地面涡度协方差系统获得的数据集与来自空中遥感平台的数据集之间的数据质量控制措施有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data from eddy covariance systems undergo quality control measures such as outlier removal, delay correction, and stability testing to ensure accuracy. In contrast, airborne remote sensing data involve sensor calibration, classification accuracy checks, and atmospheric corrections to account for errors in pixel classification and radiation estimates, particularly in heterogeneous landscapes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统的数据经过质量控制措施，如异常值去除、延迟修正和稳定性测试，以确保准确性。相比之下，航空遥感数据涉及传感器校准、分类准确性检查和大气修正，以考虑像素分类和辐射估计中的错误，特别是在异质景观中。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the quality assessment criteria used in data processing, such as atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics, enhance the reliability of flux measurements in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在数据处理过程中使用的质量评估标准，如大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征，可以通过以下方式增强异质景观中通量测量的可靠性：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The quality assessment criteria, including atmospheric stability (Δst) and turbulence similarity characteristics (ITC), are crucial in evaluating the reliability of flux measurements. They help in filtering out measurements that are likely to be inaccurate due to unstable atmospheric conditions or weak turbulence, which is especially important in heterogeneous landscapes where such conditions can greatly affect data quality.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 质量评估标准，包括大气稳定性（Δst）和湍流相似特征（ITC），在评估通量测量的可靠性方面至关重要。它们有助于过滤掉由于不稳定的大气条件或弱湍流而可能导致不准确的测量，尤其是在异质景观中，这些条件可能会极大地影响数据质量。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the poor availability of multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致异质表面生态水文过程多尺度观测稀缺的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations is a significant challenge due to the complexity and variability of heterogeneous surfaces, which require a hierarchically nested scale approach to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes effectively.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的稀缺性是一个重大挑战，因为异质表面的复杂性和变异性需要采用分层嵌套的尺度方法，以有效捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do errors occur in the derived component temperature when using thermal imaging for soil and canopy temperature estimation?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在使用热成像进行土壤和冠层温度估计时，衍生组件温度出现错误的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the derived component temperature occur primarily due to image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors lead to overestimation of canopy temperature and uncertainties in estimated temperatures due to ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些误差导致了对冠层温度的高估，以及由于忽略了大气上行辐射和透射率而导致的温度估计不确定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of employing multiscale observation techniques in eco-hydrological research over heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中采用多尺度观测技术进行生态水文研究的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing multiscale observation techniques can lead to a better understanding of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. These techniques provide comprehensive data at various scales, enhancing the ability to investigate complex interactions such as oasis-desert dynamics. This approach can improve the accuracy of models like the TSEB model, leading to more reliable estimates of evapotranspiration components and energy fluxes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用多尺度观测技术可以更好地理解异质表面的生态水文过程。这些技术在不同尺度上提供全面的数据，增强了研究复杂相互作用（如绿洲-沙漠动态）的能力。这种方法可以提高像TSEB模型这样的模型的准确性，从而更可靠地估计蒸散发成分和能量通量。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives of implementing a multi-scale observation experiment for evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces in eco-hydrological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，实施多尺度观测实验以研究异质土地表面的蒸散发的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives of implementing a multi-scale observation experiment for evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces are to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes in such areas. This is achieved through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data, as demonstrated in the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测实验以研究异质土地表面的蒸散发的主要目标是解决在这些区域上进行生态水文过程上尺度化的挑战。这是通过在分层嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use high-resolution thermal cameras and stable isotopes for validating evapotranspiration estimates in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业地区，使用高分辨率热像仪和稳定同位素来验证蒸散发估算是非常重要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to use high-resolution thermal cameras and stable isotopes for validating evapotranspiration estimates to obtain accurate measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures. These measurements help better validate the evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates, particularly in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, where traditional methods might not provide accurate results due to environmental complexities.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪和稳定同位素来验证蒸散发估算是非常重要的，以获得土壤和树冠组分温度的准确测量。这些测量有助于更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的估算，特别是在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，传统方法可能由于环境复杂性而无法提供准确的结果。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using a hierarchical sensor network and remote sensing techniques in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert interactions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的多尺度生态水文过程时，使用分层传感器网络和遥感技术具有重要意义。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The significance of using a hierarchical sensor network and remote sensing techniques lies in their ability to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert interactions effectively. This approach allows for comprehensive data collection across different landscapes, enabling a better understanding of the interactions and processes occurring in these complex environments, as part of the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用分层传感器网络和遥感技术的意义在于它们能够有效捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的多尺度生态水文过程。这种方法允许在不同景观中进行全面的数据收集，从而更好地理解这些复杂环境中发生的相互作用和过程，作为HiWATER实验的一部分。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in processing eddy covariance flux data collected from a heterogeneous landscape, ensuring its accuracy and reliability for further analysis?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理来自异质景观的涡度协方差通量数据的程序包括哪些步骤，以确保其准确性和可靠性，以便进行进一步分析？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The processing of eddy covariance flux data involves several steps, including removing outliers, correcting for time delays, performing coordinate rotation (secondary coordinate rotation), frequency response corrections, ultrasonic virtual temperature corrections, and density corrections (WPL correction). Additionally, quality evaluation of flux values is conducted, primarily testing for atmospheric stability and turbulent similarity characteristics. Specific data are removed if the instrument malfunctions, during rainfall events, or if data loss exceeds certain thresholds.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差通量数据的处理涉及多个步骤，包括去除异常值、校正时间延迟、进行坐标旋转（次级坐标旋转）、频率响应校正、超声虚温校正和密度校正（WPL校正）。此外，还对通量值进行质量评估，主要测试大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。如果仪器故障、降雨事件发生或数据丢失超过某些阈值，则会移除特定数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model applied to estimate evapotranspiration components in complex agricultural settings, and what are the data collection methods used to support this application?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型如何应用于复杂农业环境中蒸散发成分的估算，以及支持该应用的数据收集方法。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The TSEB model is applied by using soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs. Ground-based measurements, including meteorological parameters and turbulent fluxes, aid in partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration. Observations are collected every ten minutes and include data such as air temperature, wind speed, humidity, and radiation. The soil and canopy component temperatures are calculated using thermal images and classified into soil and canopy pixels to estimate latent heat fluxes and validate the model against ground measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: TSEB模型通过使用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入进行应用。地面测量，包括气象参数和湍流通量，帮助将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。观察数据每十分钟收集一次，包括空气温度、风速、湿度和辐射等数据。土壤和冠层组件温度通过热成像计算，并将其分类为土壤像素和冠层像素，以估算潜热通量并根据地面测量验证模型。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the integration of eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统与热红外相机的结合如何提高蒸散发测量的准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras enhances the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements by providing detailed observations of turbulent fluxes and radiometric temperatures. This combination allows for precise partitioning of latent and sensible heat fluxes and accurate calculation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for reliable evapotranspiration estimates, especially in strongly advective conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统与热红外相机的结合提高了蒸散发测量的准确性，通过提供湍流通量和辐射温度的详细观测。这种组合使得潜热和显热通量的精确划分成为可能，并且能够准确计算土壤和树冠组件的温度，这对于在强烈的平流条件下获得可靠的蒸散发估计至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are there challenges in using composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions for estimating evapotranspiration?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用复合温度分离方法估算蒸散发面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Composite temperature separation approaches face challenges in arid regions because errors in derived component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors. These errors vary with vegetation abundance, leading to inaccuracies in estimating soil and canopy temperatures, which are critical for determining evapotranspiration. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can also lead to uncertainties in temperature estimation.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 复合温度分离方法在干旱地区面临挑战，因为衍生的组分温度误差主要是由图像分类错误引起的。这些误差随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致土壤和树冠温度的估计不准确，而这些温度对于确定蒸散发至关重要。此外，忽视大气向上辐射和透射率也可能导致温度估计的不确定性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model have limited application in real landscape conditions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型在实际景观条件下可能应用有限的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The TSEB model might have limited application because it requires parameters and observations that are not readily obtainable from operational satellite- and ground-based data. The model is complex, involving multiple resistances that cannot be accurately calculated, which restricts its applicability in diverse landscape conditions where accurate surface flux estimation is necessary.
Expectation.AnswerCn: TSEB模型的应用可能有限，因为它需要的参数和观测数据并不容易从操作卫星和地面数据中获得。该模型复杂，涉及多个阻力，无法准确计算，这限制了它在需要准确表面通量估计的多样化景观条件下的适用性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using eddy covariance systems for measuring turbulent fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在异质景观中使用涡动协方差系统测量湍流通量的有效性进行评估。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems for measuring turbulent fluxes is effective in heterogeneous landscapes as they are capable of capturing detailed temporal variations in fluxes. However, challenges exist such as incomplete energy balance closure which affects the accuracy of measurements. These systems are essential in providing the ground truth required to validate remote sensing models like the TSEB model.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 涡动协方差系统用于测量湍流通量在异质景观中是有效的，因为它们能够捕捉通量的详细时间变化。然而，存在一些挑战，例如能量平衡闭合不完全，这会影响测量的准确性。这些系统在提供验证遥感模型（如TSEB模型）所需的真实数据方面是必不可少的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you assess the challenges of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces with regard to data availability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，特别是在数据可用性方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is notably challenging due to the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER aims to address this by producing multiscale and multidisciplinary data through a hierarchically nested observation system, capturing interactions across different scales, thus providing a more comprehensive dataset for analysis.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面的上尺度化面临显著挑战，主要是由于多尺度观测的可用性较差。HiWATER旨在通过分层嵌套的观测系统生成多尺度和多学科的数据，捕捉不同尺度之间的相互作用，从而提供更全面的分析数据集。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the potential of remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers to improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration models in irrigated agricultural areas?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对遥感技术如LiDAR和热成像仪在提高灌溉农业地区蒸散发模型准确性方面的潜力有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR and thermal imagers hold significant potential for improving the accuracy of evapotranspiration models. They provide spatially extensive data that can be integrated with ground-based measurements to enhance model inputs and outputs. These technologies are crucial for capturing variations in surface temperature and vegetation structure, which are vital for refining estimations of soil and canopy component temperatures in models like the TSEB.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 遥感技术如激光雷达（LiDAR）和热成像仪在提高蒸散发模型的准确性方面具有重要潜力。它们提供了空间广泛的数据，可以与地面测量结果结合，以增强模型的输入和输出。这些技术对于捕捉地表温度和植被结构的变化至关重要，这些变化对于在像TSEB这样的模型中细化土壤和树冠组成温度的估算至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how challenges in multiscale observation are addressed in eco-hydrological studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解生态水文研究中如何解决多尺度观测的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment addresses these challenges by using a hierarchical network of diverse instruments and sensors across different scales. This includes flux towers, remote sensing technologies, and ground-based measurements to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes comprehensively.
Assertion.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验通过在不同尺度上使用多样化的仪器和传感器的分层网络来应对这些挑战。这包括通量塔、遥感技术和地面测量，以全面捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges associated with collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在异质表面上收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment was specifically designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度研究的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验专门设计用于通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection methods used to measure evapotranspiration in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述在强烈的平流灌溉农业区测量蒸散发所使用的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the field, ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET). These temperatures were observed via a high-resolution thermal camera and used as inputs to the TSEB model, validated using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and eddy covariance (EC) measurements. Additionally, meteorological parameters and turbulent fluxes were measured using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在现场，通过地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度来估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）。这些温度通过高分辨率热像仪观察，并作为输入用于TSEB模型，使用稳定的氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度协方差（EC）测量进行验证。此外，气象参数和湍流通量通过一个采样频率为10 Hz的EC系统进行测量。
